by Erowid

SUMMARY #


                    Context: 
                    This section appears within Erowid's comprehensive resource site, following the library and donation/store listings, and serves as the introduction to a detailed page on drug testing for buprenorphine (brands include Temgesic, Subutex, Buprenex, Suboxone) under the pharmaceuticals category, providing summary information on its detectability in drug tests.

Buprenorphine (Temgesic; Subutex; Buprenex; Suboxone)

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY Buprenorphine Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? NO Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? Sometimes Possible to Test for? YES Detection Period in Urine 2-4 days

TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing


                    Context: 
                    This section provides an overview of how buprenorphine (known as Temgesic, Subutex, Buprenex, Suboxone) is detected in drug testing, summarizing whether it is included in standard and extended drug tests, the possibility of specific testing, typical urine detection periods, and information about urine testing methods. It is part of Erowid's comprehensive guide on drug testing for pharmaceuticals.

metadata.title: Erowid Buprenorphine (Temgesic, Subutex) Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Buprenorphine (Temgesic, Subutex) and drug testing

content:
Drug: Buprenorphine | cid: 644073
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Buprenorphine (Temgesic, Subutex) and drug testing
Erowid name: buprenorphine
Category: PHARMS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    Buprenorphine does not cause a positive result in a standard opiate urine quick test (stick, cup, etc). Many opiate tests test only for morphine (which both codeine and heroin break down into). This is true for both home/business kits and laboratory testing. Because buprenorphine does not break down into morphine, it is therefore not detected by these tests. Home and laboratory testing is available that will detect buprenorphine. Test results depend on the specific test that is used and whether or not laboratory verification is required. When drug testing is being conducted on known opioid users, specific buprenorphine testing is sometimes used to verify that it is not being used. Because buprenorphine has become more popular among prisoners and opioid addicts since the mid 2000s, there are more labs that look for buprenorphine and more groups that have added it to their list of substances identified. When urine samples are sent for lab confirmation, buprenorphine is usually detected.


                    Context: 
                    This section explains how buprenorphine is detected in various drug tests, clarifying that standard opiate urine screens do not detect it because they only test for morphine-based metabolites. It appears within Erowid's summary on buprenorphine drug testing, outlining which tests can identify buprenorphine, under what circumstances specialized testing is used, and recent trends in laboratory testing practices for this opioid.

metadata.title: Erowid Buprenorphine (Temgesic, Subutex) Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Buprenorphine (Temgesic, Subutex) and drug testing

content:
Drug: Buprenorphine | cid: 644073
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Buprenorphine (Temgesic, Subutex) and drug testing
Erowid name: buprenorphine
Category: PHARMS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #
